front.title: PPP Public Key Encryption Based Authentication

abstract.t: The Point-to-Point Protocol (PPP) [1] provides a standard method of encapsulating Network Layer protocol information over point-to-point links. PPP also defines an extensible Link Control Protocol, which allows negotiation of an Authentication Protocol for authenticating its peer before allowing Network Layer protocols to transmit over the link. Public Key Encryption authentication provides another choice of a very secure protocol for PPP authentication.
